results.definition: a characteristic state or mode of living
examples: social life
city life
real life

results.definition: the experience of being alive; the course of human events and activities
examples: he could no longer cope with the complexities of life

results.definition: the course of existence of an individual; the actions and events that occur in living
examples: he hoped for a new life in Australia
he wanted to live his own life without interference from others

results.definition: the condition of living or the state of being alive
examples: while there's life there's hope
life depends on many chemical and physical processes

results.definition: the period during which something is functional (as between birth and death)
examples: the battery had a short life
he lived a long and happy life

results.definition: the period between birth and the present time
examples: I have known him all his life

results.definition: the period from the present until death
examples: he appointed himself emperor for life

results.definition: a living person
examples: his heroism saved a life

results.definition: animation and energy in action or expression
examples: it was a heavy play and the actors tried in vain to give life to it

results.definition: living things collectively
examples: the oceans are teeming with life

results.definition: the organic phenomenon that distinguishes living organisms from nonliving ones
examples: there is no life on the moon

results.definition: an account of the series of events making up a person's life
a motive for living
examples: pottery was his life

results.definition: a prison term lasting as long as the prisoner lives
examples: he got life for killing the guard

results.definition: inhabit or live in; be an inhabitant of
examples: People lived in Africa millions of years ago
The people inhabited the islands that are now deserted
this kind of fish dwells near the bottom of the ocean
deer are populating the woods

results.definition: lead a certain kind of life; live in a certain style
examples: we had to live frugally after the war

results.definition: continue to live through hardship or adversity
examples: We went without water and food for 3 days
These superstitions survive in the backwaters of America
The race car driver lived through several very serious accidents
how long can a person last without food and water?

results.definition: support oneself
examples: he could barely exist on such a low wage
Can you live on $2000 a month in New York City?
Many people in the world have to subsist on $1 a day

results.definition: have life, be alive
examples: Our great leader is no more
My grandfather lived until the end of war

results.definition: have firsthand knowledge of states, situations, emotions, or sensations
examples: I know the feeling!
have you ever known hunger?
I have lived a kind of hell when I was a drug addict
The holocaust survivors have lived a nightmare
I lived through two divorces

results.definition: pursue a positive and satisfying existence
examples: You must accept yourself and others if you really want to live
